properties.Name: Silver Lake
properties.Description: Swim in the summer and snowshoe across in the winter

properties.Name: Skylight Pond
properties.Description: Just awesome

properties.Name: Bristol Falls
properties.Description: Great swimming hole with places to jump off rocks and climb behind a waterfall

properties.Name: Sugarbush Ski Resort: Lincoln Peak
properties.Description: Lincoln Peak is one of the two slopes affiliated with Sugarbush Resort. There are a large variety of trails and lifts for all ski and snowboard abilities!

properties.Name: Sugarbush Ski Resort: Mount Ellen
properties.Description: One of the two ski slopes in the Sugarbush Resort. A great variety of trails for all skill levels.

properties.Name: Mad River Glen
properties.Description: Home to one of the oldest chair lifts in the state, Mad River Glen is a smaller local ski slope with great, challenging trails. No snowboards allowed., however!

properties.Name: Ben & Jerry's
properties.Description: Iconic, creative ice cream parlor chain

properties.Name: ECHO Lake Aquarium and Science Center
properties.Description: Hands-on learning about Lake Champlain

properties.Name: Lake Champlain Maritime Museum
properties.Description: Exhibits on local nautical history

properties.Name: Shelburne Museum
properties.Description: Vast collection of folk & decorative art

properties.Name: Rutland Bowlerama
properties.Description: This bowling alley is a great place to spend a few hours knocking down pins for only $3 per game and $1 for shoes (student rates in 2015). A wonderful activity for icky weather.

properties.Name: Cacklin' Hens
properties.Description: This is a knitting shop that has a wide selection of yarns and friendly, knowledgeable staff. A great place to explore your craftiness on a wintry day.

properties.Name: Middlebury Marquis
properties.Description: This small two-theater cinema house plays 2 or 3 movies at a time is walking distance from campus. A perfect date night location - but the food from the adjoined Mexican restaurant is not recommended.... Occasionaly the theater also hosts concerts.

properties.Name: Rikert Nordic Center
properties.Description: Great cross country skiing through many miles of wooded trails.

properties.Name: Whirlie's World
properties.Description: Great place to play laser tag with a few friends.

properties.Name: Community Supper at the Congregational Church
properties.Description: A wonderful place to volunteer and eat dinner on Friday afternoons.  If you want to actually organize a dinner yourself (for 200-300 people!), you can get money from your Commons, the Service Cluster Board, and many other organizations on campus.

properties.Name: Trader Joe's
properties.Description: Right near the airport, with a great wine selection, plenty of healthy frozen food options, and fantastic fresh produce.

properties.Name: Champlain Lanes
properties.Description: A fun bowling alley in South Burlington.

properties.Name: Flynn Theater
properties.Description: Some great concerts come through this awesome old theater every year--definitely worth checking it out!

properties.Name: Waterfront Diving Center
properties.Description: You can get your SCUBA certification here or go on dives on Lake Champlain.

properties.Name: Merrill's Roxy Cinema
properties.Description: A great movie theater on Church Street that shows all the alternative films that don't make it to Middlebury.

properties.Name: Higher Ground
properties.Description: Wonderful atmosphere and fairly inexpensive music in Burlington.

properties.Name: Shelburne Market
properties.Description: Wonderful local supermarket in Shelburne.  You can get a huge variety of yogurt, sliced deli meats, excellent baking chocolate, among other fresh food items.

properties.Name: Cafe Provence
properties.Description: Great authentic French Food

properties.name: Park Squeeze Diner
properties.destription: For a casual burger and brew, head to the Park Squeeze! Local meat and craft beers make Wednesday Night 1/2 Burger night an essential weeknight treat!

properties.Name: Vergenne's Laundry
properties.Description: Artisan bread, pastries and coffee

properties.Name: Rustic Roots
properties.Description: Hidden gem of a restaurant. It serves delicious food with fresh ingredients for breakfast and lunch.

properties.Name: Parker Pie Co. - West Glover, VT
properties.Description: Best Pizza in the Northeast Kingdom

properties.name: The Mad Taco
properties.description: If you're mad for tacos, this place is for you! The funky, small town vibe paired with the most amazing tacos in Vermont this is the place to go! Only 45 minutes away from Middlebury, hit the small snack shack up after a day of skiing.

properties.Name: Falls Of Lana Trail
properties.Description: Short hike to beautiful waterfalls

properties.Name: Chipman Hill
properties.Description: Easy running trail

properties.Name: Amphitheater
properties.Description: Not on campus but a really cool spot to see!

properties.Name: Skylight Pond Trailhead
properties.Description: 2.3 mi hike to Skylight Pond

properties.Name: Blueberry Hill
properties.Description: 50km ungroomed cross country ski trails. Suggested donation $10 each.

properties.Name: Bread and Puppet
properties.Description: Puppet theater, political commentary, art, posters. Great to see their summer show! http://breadandpuppet.org/

properties.Name: Equinox Mountain Hiking Trail
properties.Description: Great 3 hour round trip hike with beautiful views of the valley

properties.Name: Snake Mountain Trail Head
properties.Description: Classic Midd Kid hiking spot

properties.Name: Mount Mansfield
properties.Description: Highest mountain in VT with incredible scenery

properties.name: Forest City Trail Buckets
properties.Description: Great spot to stop in after hiking Camel's Hump. Park at the Forest City Parking area. Up and down river from this point, there are multiple swimming holes. Start at the Forest City Trail and cross over the bridge at about .4 miles. You'll find numerous good swimming and dunking holes on the left.

properties.name: Bolton potholes
properties.description: 5 waterfalls that each create their own pool of water. The last one also has a rocky beach. As one of the closest swimming holes to Burlington, it can be very popular on warm summer days. Head upstream to get away from the crowds.

properties.name: Lareau park
properties.description: This swimming hole offers a little something for everyone. Shallow waters near the shore are great for little ones learning how to tread water, while directly across the river, rocks provide a seven-foot-tall platform to leap into a 12-foot-deep water for the older, bolder crowd.  Bring a picnic and a blanket--it also boasts a sandy bank, grass picnic area, parking and toilet facilities. Or stop by American Flatbread for dinner afterwards. It's located just down the road.

properties.Name: Lake Pleiad
properties.Description: Half way up the Snow Bowl and accessible from the Long Trail, this is a beautiful (cold) remote lake! If you bring a paddle, a brave soul hiked his canoe up the mountain for the enjoyment of all

properties.Name: Falls of Lana
properties.Description: This beautiful waterfall is a short hike from the Silver Lake trail head. A great place for cliff jumping!
Bring a soccer ball, a six pack, and your swim suits! Often packed on sunny Saturdays, the Lake Dunmore beach is only 20 minutes drive from Middlebury
properties.Name: Lake Dunmore Beach
Silver Lake
properties.Description: Hike about 1.2 miles from the Silver Lake trailhead, this is a beautiful lake with a stunning view

properties.Name: Dorset Quarry
properties.Description: A private quarry open to the public, with clear and cold water and great cliffs for jumping

properties.name: Otter Creek Gorge
properties.Description: Perfect for late-afternoon swims -- faces west and catches rays until sunset. Murky, fast-moving water through the Gorge, billowing out into a fat pool. The best cliff-jump around. Jump from anywhere on either side of the Gorge into the edge of the rapids. Get here via Beldon Falls Rd and the TAM. Cross the bridge and head north. Watch out for high water.

properties.name: Dog Team Road
properties.Description: Park right past the fence that says "DO NOT PARK" and follow the signs to the river path. Swim right away, trek up towards the falls (good for jumping), or follow the river path downriver to the Secret Beach. Jump from cliffs on the far bank or float down the bends of the river. Make it under the railroad tracks and around another bend and there is a rope swing into another deep pool. Beware of leeches and crawdads.

properties.name: Red Rocks
properties.description: Jump off any of the cliffs at the end of this peninsula into the deep depths of Lake Champlain Bring shoes if you want to do the 90 footer. There's a dynamite view of the lake/ mountains combo. Try to hitchhike on a motor boat - someone might take you tubing if you ask nicely.

properties.Name: Middlebury Gorge
properties.Description: This is a great place to swim, with nice deep calm water, explore under the bridge!

properties.Name: Pre-Gorge Hole
properties.Description: This smaller, secret spot is down the hill from the side of the road

properties.Name: Warren Falls
properties.Description: This incredible spot has several crystal clear waterfalls, a must see, drive over Lincoln Gap to get there!

properties.Name: Tea Cups
properties.Description: This is such a fun, underused swimming hole. Similar to Warren Falls but without the vertical, its fairly close to Midd as well
